Bangun Jalan 7 Km di Perbatasan Malaysia, TNI Harap Warga Makin Sejahtera
01 Nov 2019, 03:02 by Eva Safitri
Jakarta - TNI membangun jalan sepanjang 7 km di perbatasan Malaysia, tepatnya di Kabupaten Malinau, Kalimantan Utara. Kegiatan ini merupakan bagian dari program TNI Manunggal Membangun Desa (TMMD) ke-106.
Pelaksanaan program TMMD ke-106 di Kodim 0910/Malinau tersebut dilaksanakan di Desa Long Bisai Kecamatan Mentarang karena transportasi menuju ke desa terdekat harus menggunakan transportasi sungai. Hal itulah yang menjadi faktor mahalnya harga kebutuhan pokok.
"Sasaran fisik berupa pembukaan jalan sejauh 7.000 meter dengan lebar 7 meter hasil kerja sama dengan pemerintah daerah, diyakini akan meningkatkan kesejahteraan masyarakat karena akses masyarakat untuk kegiatan pertanian dan perkebunan semakin mudah," kata Kapendam VI/Mulawarman Kolonel Kav Dino Martino, dalam keterangan tertulisnya, Kamis (31/10/2019).
Dino berharap pembangunan jalan ini dapat membuat warga lebih sejahtera. Selain itu, diharapkan mobilitas warga setempat menjadi mudah dan harga bahan pokok tetap stabil.
"Hal berdampak pada hasil produksi masyarakat akan lebih mudah diantarkan ke pasar dan mobilitas barang pokok akan jauh lebih murah harganya untuk bisa meningkatkan daya beli masyarakat perbatasan desa Long Bisai, Kecamatan Mentarang, Kabupaten Malinau," ujarnya.
Selain itu, kegiatan TMMD juga diisi dengan berbagai kegiatan nonfisik. Dalam TMMD di Kabupaten Malinau, TNI juga meningkatkan pemahaman masyarakat perbatasan tentang bela negara, wawasan kebangsaan, keamanan dan ketertiban masyarakat (kamtibmas) dan pencegahan bahaya narkoba.

Building a 7 Km Road on the Malaysian Border, TNI Hopes Citizens to Become More Prosperous
01 Nov 2019, 03:02 by Eva Safitri
Jakarta - The TNI is building a 7 km long road on the Malaysian border, precisely in Malinau District, North Kalimantan. This activity is part of the 106th TNI Manunggal Building Village (TMMD) program.
The implementation of the 106th TMMD program at Kodim 0910 / Malinau was carried out in Long Bisai Village, Mentarang District because transportation to the nearest village had to use river transportation. That is the factor of the high price of basic necessities.
"The physical target of opening a road as far as 7,000 meters with a width of 7 meters in collaboration with the local government is believed to improve the welfare of the community because community access to agricultural and plantation activities is easier," Kapendam VI / Mulawarman Kav Colonel Dino Martino said in his written statement. , Thursday (10/31/2019).
Dino hopes that the construction of this road can make citizens more prosperous. In addition, it is expected that mobility of local residents will be easy and prices of basic commodities will remain stable.
"This will have an impact on community production results that will be more easily delivered to the market and the mobility of basic goods will be much cheaper in price to be able to increase the purchasing power of the border communities of Long Bisai village, Mentarang District, Malinau Regency," he said.
In addition, TMMD activities are also filled with various non-physical activities. In TMMD in Malinau District, the TNI also increased the understanding of border communities about national defense, national insight, security and public order (kamtibmas) and prevention of the dangers of drugs.
